climbs.name: Cranberry Hand Crack
climbs.fa: Uncertain. Cimbed by Russ Johnson and Sandor Nagy (Sept. 2020)

content.description: An iconic splitter crack. Climb the roughly hand-sized crack to a resting ledge 2/3 of the way up. From there, make a few finger crack moves and grab the lip.  Mantle your way up onto the summit of the rock.You can make an anchor at the top by placing stoppers and small cams into the continuation of the crack, which goes all the way across the summit. With a long sling (that hangs over the edge) you can make a good top-rope anchor, and lower off of it.
content.protection: Very protectable with cams and wired stoppers.
content.location: At the far right side of the west face of the "Trailside Rock".

content.description: A very large boulder with several cracks on the west face.There is no fixed anchor at the top of the rock.
